forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain. Partly sunny. High near 61, with temperatures falling to around 59 in the afternoon. Southwest wind around 15 mph, with gusts as high as 22 mph. Chance of precipitation is 50%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain before 5am. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 52. Southwest wind 7 to 14 mph, with gusts as high as 20 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
Downtown San Francisco today presents a somewhat understated charm, as the city sits under a quilt of clouds, cloaked in the gentle caress of a spring breeze. The weather is defined by a chance of rain this afternoon, with temperatures peeking shyly around the low sixties. As the clouds drift lazily above, a sense of quiet anticipation hangs in the air—one can almost palpitate the promise of moisture on the horizon. The bay glimmers with a hint of mystery, softened by the marine layer that shrouds the Golden Gate in whispers of fog, offering a picturesque yet ethereal view that stirs the imagination.

Dresing for this evocative scene calls for layers; a light jacket will shield against the brisk southwest winds that stir occasionally, while a cozy scarf wraps you in warmth as the day transitions into evening. With clouds gathering, a stroll along the historic streets or a quiet visit to a local gallery could offer a serene escape from the bustle, as the tranquility of Downtown unveils itself—a lovely respite amid the layered delicacies of nature’s palette. Embrace this moment; it is not every day that the fog rolls in, and while the sun may play hide-and-seek, the city’s vibrancy is always present, even behind the clouds.
